ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would highly recommend this course for a student interested in clinical psychology. The course provides a great review of current literature in developmental psychopathology that any clinical psychology student should be familiar with.

I would recommend it for students who want a good, broad introduction to the developmental approach in psychopathology. I would describe it more as an upper-level undergraduate seminar than a highly practical graduate course.
Yes, I would recommend this class to other students.

I would recommend this course to another student, particularly one who was interested in the developmental perspective. This course was a great introduction to the complexities involved in the research of psychological abnormalities (and normality) when taking a developmental approach.
This is a course that focuses on asking questions from a developmental perspective. It is almost entirely student-run and discussion based.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course will help inform the development of ideas for future research questions.
The course was a good way to direct my thinking toward developmental questions in my research.
The work wasn't too much, the readings were helpful in broadening knowledge base and the final paper was a good practice in writing and reviewing literature.
This course gave me a new lens through which I can examine my own research interests and enlightened me to new perspectives I may not have ever considered otherwise.
This course exposed me to the basic principles of developmental psychopathology.
